description:
ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound power radiated by the source under test to the reference sound power [W_0 = 1 pW].
the frequency weighting or the width of the frequency band used should be indicated; for example A-weighted
sound power level (L_WA).
The sound power level is describing the noise emission of a machine and independent of the environment in which the machine is situated. It allows the selection of quiet machines and is a key quantity to carry out a forecast of the resulting sound pressure levels when placing a machine into an environment.
